moves.6... e6 7. Bd3 Ne7 8. O-O O-O 9. Bg5 f6: this Bishop had better things to do...
moves.12... Nbc6 13. Nxc8 Rxc8 14. Qd2: a standard lost attack, in this opening...
moves.14... d5: it took a while: but finally d5...
moves.30. Bc3 e4: a nasty trap, keeping the odds even...
moves.33. cxb5 axb5 34. Rac1 Kf6: we need to go: a pin over Ne7, after Rc7, is troublesome...
moves.42... Kxh4: I see a very cramped White King...
moves.43. Nxb5 Rd1: we already took longer than usual: time to end this...
moves.46. Kh2 f4 47. a4 e3 48. a5: this pawn, will never make it...
moves.48... Ng4+ 49. Kh1 Ng3+ 50. Kg1 e2: and suddenly, all is over: White resigned...
